reviews.review_msg: One of the best professor I've ever met in my sfu math life. I will must take him again soon.

There is no midterm, instead there is a quiz mid way through the semester, and there are weekly homework. The final exam is worth 75%. His lectures are clear and he is very open to helping students succeed in the course. Humble and can be funny when he makes analogies between math and other subjects!

He is open to questions and does not balk at "cringeworthy" or "stupid" questions. He is surprisingly accessible for help outside of his office hours. On the flip side, his homework can not only be demanding, but are sometimes downright impossible without assistance. His exams are NOT easy, though.

Please avoid this course with Nathan. The concepts in 340 CAN be fun, but Nathan seems to make the course more about flexing his math knowledge than actually walking students through abstract concepts. Docks marks like crazy rather than actually helping students learn from mistakes. Wouldn't recommend him for any proof-based course.

Absolutely not. Worst math prof I've ever had. Comes across as nice, but it's a facade. He WILL gatekeep the course. Not designed to pass, policies that auto fail students (concept comprehension exams). Insanely difficult assignments. His class made me think math wasn't for me, but having taken other upper year math courses, Nathan is just bad lol
Nice professor for Ring theory
Prof Nathan Ilten is great!

This was my first upper division math course. Nathan did a great job teaching this course, although I will say that the content itself was quite hard to grasp. You definitely have to stay on top of definitions and theorems (I did not) to get a decent grade.

Meh, he was alright. I found that he comes across as a nice guy, but doesn't make this course very accessible for students. He caps marks at a C+ if you don't score high enough on the CCE quizzes, which I didn't like very much. Nice guy, very tough grader, very difficult course. HIGHLY recommend taking Math 242 and 342 before this.

this class was challenging to say the least. ilten's lectures were alright, you really have to focus to understand the concepts he's explaining, but connecting it to the homework was very difficult and took me hours. exams were fair though and he did give extra credit so all in all, not bad

Nathan was a great prof, but MATH340 just wasn't my cup of tea lol. I personally found it very challenging, as it's by far the most proof-heavy course I've taken, and I definitely took the course too early! Definitely recommend several other MATH courses before taking on 340. But when you do take 340, take it with Nathan, he's great.

Good lecturer but very tough grader. Averages on assignments are ~ 50% give or take. Midterm was marked harshly with most of the class scoring low. His lectures are quite clear and enthusiastic, but the course is just hard. Really really hard. Good luck to you.
If you want to maintain GPA, plz choose another prof. If you are very good at math, you can.
lectures are just ok, homework can be absurdly hard, tests are based off of hw and alike(overall fair... if you knew how to do the homework)

Lectures were very messy but were uploaded online. Does almost no examples in class, so you have to understand all the theory before attempting a question. Only 1h of office hours per week. Free 10% doing discussion posts weekly which he frequently answered. Exams were VERY fair. This class requires the upmost of independence. Take with Nils Bruin.

Half his midterm was freelo. Questions were directly from lecture. Funny enough, someone got 62/40! I think he's just capping it at 40 though, so a 62/40 is equal to 40/40. Only bad part about his class is I cannot get over 100%.   Very helpful in office hours and definitely someone I would take another class with.

Theorem: The following are logically equivalent:  (1) If you are looking for a real challenge, taking MATH340 with Dr. Ilten will not leave you disappointed.  (2) If you are NOT looking for a challenge, then taking MATH340 with Dr. Ilten will DEFINITELY leave you disappointed.   Proof of (2): angry reviews. Proof of (1) is left as an exercise

I was enrolled in both of Dr. Ilten's classes in a semester, MATH 152 and MATH 340. In both classes he explained concepts very clearly, freely gave help, and his midterms were ridiculously difficult (but scaled).  He loves math, he is a genius, and he is pretty funny in lectures,  but you have to work hard (I mean really hard) to keep your GPA.
Definitely a GPA Booster. Easiest class I've taken at SFU! Prof is super nice too and easy to understand.

Lectures are well presented with the occasional ad lib joke. Proofs are detailed and mistakes in the book are pointed out. Assignments are tough, but solutions (after) are clear and logical. His exam prep sessions are helpful, and the exams themselves are fair and heavily based on the textbook. Marking can be austere, but that affects everyone.

Really enjoyed his class. For a proof-heavy class, he made all the concepts easy to understand and all proofs flowed logically and easily. A slight accent, but still understandable. Seems intimidating when questions are asked during lecture, but is a very nice guy in his office hours. Tests are relatively easy, but fair. Overall, Excellent prof.

Prof. Monagan is one of the few professors at SFU who actually knows how to teach. He is caring, helping, and willing to take feedback. He takes his time to go through proofs and explain concepts clearly. During office hours he reaches out for you and goes out of his way to explain things simply. Take him if you have the chance.

Pros: Nice person who is very approachable; He has a deep interest in applying the course material; His tests are the definition of fair; He cares deeply about his students and is very understanding if you're having difficulty with the course; His assignments are very fair. Cons: the book he uses sucks; he doesnt give a big picture of the course

Michael's lectures are clear and organized. If you go to all the lectures, you will know everything so that reading the textbook is not even mandatory. Assignments are pretty lengthy. Each probably takes up 6 to 10 hours, but questions are well related with the course material. Tests are really fair. Overall, one of the best math prof in SFU.

Nice guy who cares. Will give students help like assignment extensions. Makes a moderate effort to put course materials online, but notes are an exception. Exams are fair. Gives a decent amount of assignments (8 over 12 lecture weeks). Class is fairly boring.

Very clear, very fair, not very hard.  Loves using MAPLE to program (whether necessary to course or not, but give him credit he helped program it), so keep this in mind.  Final exam is marked hard though, but all in all a great professor.
Excellent Prof. He really knows his subject well. Rings and Fields have been one of the most interesting courses I have taken. If you complete all the homework you will do fine!
Gives great lectures, explains everything very well. Assignments/exam were somewhat difficult but fair and marked reasonably. Would definitely recommend taking a class with him.
Best professor
Boss.

Dr Levinson's passion for teaching and mathematics is clear, as he answers questions and gives feedback even outside of class time. Moreover, he is empathetic: he restructured the course based on how we were doing, and especially looked out for struggling students. I've had great profs, but Dr Levinson is on another level.

Jake is undoubtedly one of the best professors at SFU period (not just in the Mathematics department). He is kind, respected, and among all else, an inspiration to those wanting to become an instructor. On top of making a notoriously difficult class manageable, he joined the Discord that I created for the class to answer questions on his free time.
Spectacular prof. Joined the class discord, and gave input and feedback whenever there were questions.
Massive respect as a prof. Joined the class discord, and gave input to any questions posed.
Unorganized, just nice. Does not replies to email.

Prof. Levinson is one of the best profs I've ever had. He cares a lot about his students and is easily accessible outside of class. He is very interactive and can make a boring or difficult subject interesting. Take his class while you can.

Just do yourself a favor and take a class with this Prof. Jake is somehow a perfect balance of being smart, approachable, and organized. On top of all that he even cut our class some slack mid-semester when we were all feeling burned out. This really helped us catch up on the material and continue to succeed for the rest of the semester.
Genuinely friendly and empathetic. Good notes, very fair coursework. Very helpful lectures.

Jake is by far one of the best and most caring professors I have ever had. He is always available for students to reach out to him and you can tell he really wants you to succeed. He made a very difficult course quite enjoyable. Assignments are a bit difficult but he is very helpful in office hours.

Jake is caring, understanding, and will genuinely do anything he can in order for you to learn the material. His lecture recordings can be a bit fast paced, but he's ALWAYS accessible to answer questions. Assignments are somewhat tough, but nothing you can't do with the help of him and your classmates. It was an honour being taught by him.
Very pleasantly surprised by how good of a teacher he was, and how well set up the students were. I'd absolutely recommend him for 340, even if his reviews for other courses don't appear to be great.

Not a bad instructor, clearly passionate about the subject and approachable for help in office hours. Exams are quite reasonable, made passable just by reproducing definitions/basic proofs. Keep in mind this is for an upper-division math course (abstract algebra), as per the reviews below he could be very difficult for calc1/2.

Dr. Bruin is a great lecturer for MATH 340. He knows the course material super well and delivers it well. He is very open to questions during lectures and seems happy to clarify any confusing steps in a proof or example. Very enthusiastic during lectures, you can tell he's truly passionate about math and algebra.

It was not too bad. I always asked him questions after class or during office hours and hed always explain everything to me patiently. Another thing is that I was his USRA student before and hes definitely a passionate and responsible supervisor. If youre interested in research, feel free to choose him.

Hard class, made harder by his delivery. I was struggling to keep up all semester, and he finally lost me with 2 weeks left in the semester. Materials are never explained in a digestible way. It's a hard class, and Abstract Algebra is a hard topic for first-time students, but I have since seen other professors teach it much better than he did.
One of the best Math profs at SFU. Assignments were not bad, and the tests were fair, with no surprises. Excellent.

He is a cool teacher. While he teaches though, he tends to make mistakes that can confuse the hell out of you but he is really helpful when you ask questions during class. And make sure you ask because chances are 90% of the class is confused as well. Exams were easier compared to the homework.

Make sure you understand proof theory very well before you take this class. Most of the proofs in the class are short and shouldn't be too hard. Nils does a pretty good job at illustrating the key theorems and ideas in the class. The final and midterms were fair. I highly recommend taking Math 342 before this course.

He is one the worst professor in SFU. Going to his class is absolutly no use and study with ur textbook is better. He cannot explain any of the proof, but end up putting so many proof questions on the exam. He is just SOOO bad, and if you can avoid him, please do so. It will make ur life much better!!!
